greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Product_{1<=k<=n/2, gcd(k,n)=1} k.
comment: a(n) divides A001783(n). - _M. F. Hasler_, Jul 23 2011
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..800
J. B. Cosgrave and K. Dilcher, Extensions of the Gauss-Wilson Theorem, Integers: Electronic Journal of Combinatorial Number Theory, 8 (2008)
example: The positive integers which are <= 9/2 and which are coprime to 9 are 1, 2 and 4. So a(9) = 1*2*4 = 8.
maple: a:=proc(n) local b,k: b:=1: for k from 1 to floor(n/2) do if gcd(k,n)=1 then b:=b*k else b:=b fi od: b; end: seq(a(n),n=1..41); # _Emeric Deutsch_, Nov 03 2006
mathematica: f[n_] := Times @@ Select[Range[Floor[n/2]], GCD[ #, n] == 1 &];Table[f[n], {n, 36}] (* _Ray Chandler_, Nov 12 2006 *)
program: (PARI) A124441(n)=prod(k=2, n\2, k^(gcd(k, n)==1))  \\  _M. F. Hasler_, Jul 23 2011
def Gauss_factorial(N, n): return mul(j for j in (1..N) if gcd(j, n) == 1)
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, Nov 01 2006
